summary: Caryl M Emanuel was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to February 1979. These documents detail her position and salary within the committee. The consistent appearance of her name across multiple payroll certifications indicates a sustained period of employment with the HSCA during its investigation.
significance: Caryl M Emanuel's significance lies in her role as a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her work is not detailed in these documents, her presence on payroll and certification reports confirms her involvement in the committee's operations.
